kpis.description: This KPI measures the percentage increase in revenue over a specific period, indicating the growth rate of a company's sales.
kpis.formula: ((current period revenue - previous period revenue) / previous period revenue) * 100

kpis.description: This KPI indicates the percentage of revenue that exceeds the cost of goods sold (COGS), reflecting the efficiency of production and pricing strategies.
This KPI measures the percentage of revenue left after paying for variable costs of production, indicating the efficiency of a company's core business operations.

kpis.kpi: ratio of net profit to revenue
kpis.description: This KPI shows the percentage of revenue that remains as profit after all expenses have been deducted, indicating overall profitability.

kpis.kpi: avg number of days to collect payment
kpis.description: This KPI measures the average number of days it takes for a company to receive payment after a sale, indicating the efficiency of the accounts receivable process.
kpis.formula: (accounts receivable / total credit sales) * number of days in period
